greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = number of primitive solutions to 4n+1 = x^2 + y^2.
comment: "Primitive" means that x and y are positive and mutually prime.
link: R. J. Mathar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: E.g. a(16)=2 because 65 = 8^2+1^2 = 7^2+4^2. a(11)=0 because although 45=6^2+3^2, 6 and 3 are not mutually prime. a(2)=0 because although 9=3^2+0^2, 0 is not positive.
maple: if y <= x and igcd(x,y) = 1 then
results.author: _Colin Mallows_, May 10 2005
